storyInfo: As everything draws to an end, a useful truth is plucked from the wreckages of frustration. The truth is a building material, from which war will be constructed.

attributes.content: *gasp* —!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Over here!
Hurry! Grab my hand!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: A single, solitary boat.
How far is it from the Eye of Iberia? How far is it from Gran Faro?
Ah, um, okay—!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Irene grabs onto his hand.
There is no difference between the hand of an Ægir and that of a Liberi.
Um— S-Sorry, I'm not very strong...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's... fine...
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I was scared out of my wits when I saw the ship explode in the distance! Are you all okay?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: As long as you're fine, Irene. Adjust your breathing. You know how to swim, right?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Luckily for us, the waters are pretty calm right now.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: *gasp*... *gasp*... Where are the others?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...I need to check on a few things.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Just now, was that... Ægir? This close to us? Has the Stultifera been circling above an Ægir city this entire time?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: We might've been able to find a way in to check out the city on our own, but you never would've made it.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Plus, the squad captain didn't seem keen on just going home happily ever after. And no way would there be a city this close to land; I don't remember anything like that.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: So, are you going to head back to that city?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: No. Gladiia said this place is also Seaborn territory. The city must be a refugee village.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The Ægir you people call Islanders are refugees from the collapse of the cities closest to land.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...We should go help them.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Two things.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ulpianus isn't dead, but he refused to work with us.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And there are still other Seaborn nearby, drawn here by that spurt of evolution. The entire swarm is extremely restless.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We can use this opportunity to get back down there, but we wouldn't be able to leave.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: So... we finally found a city from our homeland, and now we're just going to turn around and leave?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Gladiia wordlessly glances at Skadi.
She hides it well. Just as she did herself, in all those silent moments when she gently rubbed her neck.
We don't have a choice.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Why?!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: There shouldn't be a city here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We... We should head back to shore and regroup.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Our duty is to defend Ægir, not to 'go home.'
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How'd you manage this?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Huh? Oh, are you talking to me? What do you mean?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: This ship is even more bare-bones than ours was. And how did you find us? The sea is incredibly vast.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I... I compared each of the signals from the Stultifera Navis to her location... and discovered a pattern. So I thought, um, it might be worth a shot...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Worth a shot? What kind of deviation was there in that pattern?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Umm, two to three hundred nautical miles?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That can't even be called a pattern. If you had bet wrong, you would've had slim to no chance of meeting up with us, and died out at sea on your own.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...You're a lunatic.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But... I wanted to ask a question... So please don't laugh at me, ma'am.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I can't laugh anymore.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Am I a great person?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Your grandparents, your parents... two generations of Gran Faro gave everything they had for this blueprint. Their greatness should have been immortalized forever.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I wouldn't go that far.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Maybe a lucky one.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Haha... Is that so?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Maestro... and my other colleagues in the Inquisition, always held this belief:
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Only those who've sacrificed themselves are worthy of the word, 'great.' In every moment where we're fighting for Iberia and struggling to survive, we are nothing more than ordinary people, striding forward with enormous responsibilities.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: And it's not that Inquisitors enjoy belittling ourselves. We've simply chosen to deal with Iberia in the harshest way possible because the moment we let our guards down, we will be undone.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But until then, as long as the will of man is enough to ignite this lantern, then I believe... there isn't any difference between us.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: We're just like all those citizens struggling bitterly in their own ways. As long as we have goodwill to spare, they too are soldiers willing to lay down their lives for the restoration of their homeland.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Just like the laborers of old Gran Faro.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Jordi, luck won't be on your side forever. If you have a chance to contact the Inquisition again... Um, what I mean is, if you want to work with us—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: —You'll definitely have that opportunity.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Haha... Well, I actually... Um, just out of curiosity...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I see you've brought back some of the Stultifera's timeless knowledge. Might you actually be—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You managed to rescue three Hunters in a single breath. As an Ægir, your actions might be worth a medal from the consul herself.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Swimming back would've been very hard. And who knows what could happen right above their nest?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I have no idea what compelled someone like you, born in Gran Faro, to go this far, but good job.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: On behalf of the Ægir... and the Iberians.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...Mhm.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Then let's head back home!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Welcome back, Hunters. And Irene, of course.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The High Inquisitor, he...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: How did you know?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We've already sorted through his relics. Including those of our comrades who died beneath this lighthouse.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We won't be able to deal with them properly until the Penal Battalion arrives though.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: These lowly Sea Terrors could not defeat High Inquisitor Dario, but in order to protect the Eye of Iberia, he chose to lay down his life to buy time.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Inquisitors have no time to grieve, Irene. Dario had great expectations for you, and you must move forward.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...Yes, sir!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: However...
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: His lantern remains intact, and I've placed it over there.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Go now.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Yes, sir...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Seems like the Penal Battalion ran into some trouble. So much for the great naval power of Iberia.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...So the Stultifera Navis has sunk. This isn't quite the outcome we were expecting either.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Indeed. Even for us, this is a significant setback.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But we learned quite a few things, and—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You found an Ægir city.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Kal'tsit has already shared her conjecture with me, so perhaps you will wish to hear it too.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The Inquisition has always believed in maintaining control. From Sal Viento to the Stultifera, we will gradually recapture the glory that rightfully belongs to Iberia.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But we are forced to admit that, perhaps, even preserving the status quo is enough to... stretch our forces thin.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Madame Consul—
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What did you witness aboard that ship?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: This is his lantern... The High Inquisitor's lantern... Scorched black, thick with the stench of Sea Terrors.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I... High Inquisitor...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Maestro!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I completed the Inquisition's mission! I found the Stultifera!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Unfortunately, it ended up sinking! But... aboard the ship, every single Iberian! In their own way, they were fighting until the very end!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: High Inquisitor!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I now... understand the significance of passing judgment! I understand the enemy we face!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: I— will not hesitate, nor will I falter!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: For Iberia's prosperity, for Iberia's defense, and for Iberia's orderliness and integrity, I shall raise my sword and my light!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Alfonso, he... No, this can't be!
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Sixty years? What torture is this? Even a criminal subjected to the harshest of punishment would not last for a year!
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But he... he...
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Carmen falls silent. He leans over and sits down on the reef.

Sea Terrors carcasses are piled high into a mountain. There is no trace of the eldritch beasts, only the remaining tendrils of the nethersea brand retreating back to sea. The ocean's surface emits a pale blue light, usurping the sky's privilege.
He should be enjoying this victory. He accomplished what the Inquisition set out to do. The Penal Battalion is about to arrive, and all things are about to reach a satisfactory conclusion.
But he can only remain silent.
Up until a steam whistle roars in the distance. The Penal Battalion has arrived at the Eye of Iberia.
You can see the corner of the town from here. If I remember right, it was called... Reconstruction Hill.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Thiago didn't pass peacefully, and I don't know if that's a good or a bad thing. But...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Still, thank you all.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Don't mention it.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: I don't mind dedicating a song to a hero at a solemn funeral.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Seems like Frost is back.
attributes.name: Alty

attributes.content: Mhm. We'll head back too in a little bit.
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: What about you, Iberian? You've had a rough few days, haven't you?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: Gran Faro is Thiago's hometown. Just as Ægir is home to all of you, as well as my Abyssal Hunter buddies.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Maybe I joke around too much normally, and forgot...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: That Iberia is also my home. To be honest, this isn't cathartic at all.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Wasn't that doctor going to help you out with something? You've been working for her, haven't you?
attributes.name: Aya

attributes.content: No, that's already dealt with. That's why I'm willing to stay with Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: That said...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...I didn't do a damn thing.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hurry, hurry! Move the supplies into the warehouse!
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: Huh, what about the number of tents? Didn't the old guy already explain it?! Ugh—
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: J-Jordi? You're back?
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: What? The Inquisition took you away and actually let you come back? Where did you go?
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: A bunch of people from the Penal Battalion took us away, but then brought us back into town. Seems like they're going to war with something, and now they want us setting up tents.
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: Jeez, what's going to happen to Gran Faro? Oh, and uh, have you seen Thiago?
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: Jordi Fontanarossa.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Ah... Lord Carmen, sir... And Madame Inquisitor!
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: ...Mhm.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: We'd like to have a private chat with this Ægir.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Ah, of course! Right away!
attributes.name: Tense Townsperson

attributes.content: M-Me?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Come with me. Let's take a walk around town, shall we?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Irene made up her mind on the way back.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: M-Made up her mind? About what?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Originally, High Inquisitor Dario intended to entrust Irene to me, so that I could cultivate her until she was prepared for the seat of High Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: His death in battle was unexpected. Though the day would've come sooner or later, he did not have to accept his fate so soon.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: But Irene has made up her mind.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: She will give up her position as Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Huh? Wait, what? Why?!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: This is a decision I've come to after a lot of thought.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: It has nothing to do with you, though, so please just keep listening.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Oh, okay...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The problem is you, Ægir. You know too much. You're too deeply involved. And the Ægir in this town are too blasphemous.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You've also been of great help.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: As frail and weak as you are, your death would've been but another grain of sand. But you have shown great strength. Even if it's nothing more than your own little spark, it is still valuable.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I... I keep thinking... Why am I still alive? I'm not as noble as you any of you, or as resolute.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jordi, you will be... the first Ægir to join the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Huh? Wha–? Me? Join the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Strictly speaking, I won't give you a chance to refuse. Gran Faro needs more hands than ever, and you will play a pivotal role as an Ægir.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: After that, hrmm. Maybe I could use a young secretary?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Wait, hold on, you want me? To join the Inquisition?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: B-But I'm not sure if I want—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I know you don't. Many members of the Inquisition hold deeply-rooted prejudices against the Ægir, and wouldn't want you joining either.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: But don't you want to see it? The future that Iberia once promised to Gran Faro, and to Thiago?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Joining the Inquisition will be a test. As an Ægir, you wouldn't be wrong to treat it as a trial by fire. Or as practice for enduring hardship.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Don't get the wrong idea.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I... I'll give it some thought.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Then, what about you, Doña Irene? Your maestro...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My status as an Inquisitor hasn't done me any favors in my relationship with the Abyssal Hunters, or even the Ægir, so I got rid of it.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: But abandoning a faith that's supported me to this day, especially after the untimely demise of my maestro... has not been an easy decision.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Please... let's not talk about this now. Maybe if we meet again someday.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: It's just...
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Irene looks at the sculpture in the plaza. A scaled-down version of the Eye of Iberia.
In the chaos of battle, streets were torn up, houses were destroyed, and makeshift tents were erected.
And the statue has always looked out over all of it.
Even though our enemy is well beyond the reach of the law, Iberia must banish this blasphemy.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Victory will be ours.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I owe you my gratitude, Frost. You helped Jordi, as well as the Hunters.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Say no more, it was just a little workout. Those disobedient little rascals aren't the only ones who can change the direction of the tides.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Next time, make sure you come cheer for us though.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Alrighty, I'm gonna go catch up with Aya and the others then.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Stepped out a second and they went and ghosted me.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: (Riffs with slight dissatisfaction)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Oh right, Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Since we came all this way, we can't just go back empty-handed. We can awaken whenever you're ready.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Aya would say the same.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: ...Thank you very much. Maybe, in time, we really will be able to form a working partnership.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Riffs to signify her departure)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: So, this is the truth that Breogan discovered.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: 'Feranmut' and 'Leviathan'. The connection between the two.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: If these massive creatures had disappeared from the ocean long ago, yet continued to survive on land in this form—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: They're not the same, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Great Yan, Sargon, Sami. These places have all faced grave situations caused by Feranmuts.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But remember.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The ocean as a catalyst of mutation is both unique and irreplaceable. Even I cannot comprehend its principles, or its trajectory.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: All I can see are the results, and make deductions from that. And what I predict is a terrible, terrible future.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Also, I'd imagine Breogan discovered more than one truth. And as you said, if there is another Abyssal Hunter still alive—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is more than one Leviathan. The one we slew is but a small part of what the Ægir civilization concealed.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Besides...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The one you killed still lives on inside Skadi's body.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then my worst-case scenario came true. You made the right choice not to return to Ægir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Rhodes Island has already done enough for us. You have your own work ahead of you. As for what comes next, we will take that step ourselves.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Rhodes Island... has its responsibilities. Our most stellar operators will ensure that the organization continues running.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I have my own responsibilities, across all these countless years.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Time and again, I have tried to resolve the problem facing Ægir. But it is far removed from the land, unique and without precedent.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We can't wait any longer.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The ocean's problem is of the same scale as Originium.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If civilization is to continue, then we must overcome this calamity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even as this world faces constant threats, divisions grow and wars ignite without cease, just as the name Stultifera Navis implies.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Terra is certainly full of fools, both malicious and ignorant, but it is also full of saints, who seek reason above madness and chaos.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Now that you know the source of evolution, all our conjectures have been verified. Ægir's cities are within reach, and even arrogant Iberia has emerged from its shell.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Chief Designer of Warfare, let us begin.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Shakes neck around in dissatisfaction)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: Calm down, Rocinante.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: (Swings neck around more violently)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: Rocinante...
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Brays)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: ...Where are we going?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The terrible waves, are coming.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: We, will defeat them.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: We, are the terrible waves.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The terrible waves. As long as there is water in the ocean, a moon in the heavens, and wind in the sky, the waves will not abate.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The enemy you see in your madness is truly too majestic.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Go! (Rasping growl) Hyah!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Elated braying)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: (Rasping roar) —!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: I will not allow, the sea, another ripple!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Go!
attributes.name: The Last Knight
